A sign in a Wellcome supermarket in Causeway Bay warns of a new ban on the sale of alcohol to children aged under 18 that came into force at midnight yesterday. The measure regulates alcohol sales the same as tobacco and means shopkeepers will have to ask customers for an ID to verify they are aged 18 or above, or risk prosecution.

Major retailers had previously adopted voluntarily a measure to refuse alcohol sales to under -18s. But a review by the Post last year found this was rarely effective

The move was prompted by a worrying trend of binge drinking among youngsters. The law does not apply to under-18s consuming alcohol at family or social events with no business intent
